items.title: US stocks open higher but indexes on track for weekly losses amid slowdown fears
items.description: U.S. stocks rebounded on Friday, but all three main indexes were on track for weekly declines following a selloff earlier in the week, triggered by fears of a growth slowdown due to the Trump administration's erratic trade policies.

items.title: Safety net of necessity and annuity: 6 stocks with an upside potential of up to 36%
items.description: Bears have taken all the revenge for being kept out of the market for a long time. Every stock has been hammered. In such a scenario, there are two possible investment strategies. One: Buy with the clarity that it is for the next three to five years. And forget about it. Second: Be tactical. That is, buy a stock with a clearly defined time period and reason. As the situation in the equity market is still evolving, some money could be employed in tactical investing. Three sets of stocks fit the bill for such investing: Stocks from sectors where demand does not drop even in a slowdown. Or stocks of companies which meet a certain “need” that is always there. Or where there is an element of annuity income.

items.title: Axis Securities names 3 top stock picks for March 2025
items.description: The benchmark index has continued its downward trend for the fifth straight month, testing critical support at the 22,000 level. A substantial bearish candle has formed, with lower highs and lower lows, signaling ongoing weakness in the market. The index closed below the previous month’s low, reinforcing a cautious sentiment among investors.

items.title: As Wall Street gets worried, retail investors keep buying US stocks
items.description: Despite a market downturn fueled by Trump’s trade war, retail investors poured $7.3 billion into stocks, favoring Tesla and leveraged ETFs. While Wall Street grows cautious, individual investors remain bullish, raising concerns that a true market bottom is yet to come.

items.title: Xiaomi shares pricing ‘near-perfect execution’ after 300% rally
items.description: Xiaomi's stock has surged 340% in a year, making it one of China’s most expensive tech stocks. Investors await its earnings and the launch of its YU7 electric SUV, a key test for its ambitious $10 billion EV expansion.

items.title: BMW expects 1 billion euro hit to earnings as tariff war escalates
items.description: BMW anticipates trade tariffs will cost the company 1 billion euros in 2024, impacting its earnings margin. Tariffs, including 25% on steel and aluminium, and import tariffs on BMW vehicles to the U.S., are affecting global trade. Net profit fell by over a third due to weak sales in China and Germany. Investors were disappointed by the lower-than-expected margin forecast.

items.title: Struggling to choose between RIL and Airtel? Hemang Jani explains how to approach both
items.description: Elon Musk's SpaceX plans to enter India's telecom sector with Starlink, intensifying competition between Bharti Airtel and Reliance. Market expert Hemang Jani suggests Reliance offers better value, while Bharti remains resilient but largely priced in. Investors must weigh risk and reward.

items.title: European shares set for weekly loss on heightened trade tensions
items.description: European shares remained steady on Friday but were set for a weekly decline due to escalating trade tensions and concerns over economic slowdown. BMW's profit drop and tariffs announced by President Trump impacted investor sentiment, with significant declines in auto stocks and Universal Music Group.

items.title: Be greedy when others are fearful—The key to long-term investment success
items.description: Stopping SIPs during market downturns can hurt long-term gains. Data shows that markets typically recover, rewarding patient investors. Rupee cost averaging helps accumulate units at lower prices, leading to higher returns when the market rebounds. Stay invested for wealth creation.

items.title: 10 biggest multibaggers since last Holi are all smallcaps with up to 763% returns
items.description: While India's heartbeat index BSE Sensex has managed to rise by just 1.6% since the last Holi on March 25, 2024, there are 56 stocks in the broader markets that have given multibagger returns since then. Here is a list of 10 biggest multibaggers:

items.title: Global stocks rise on relief rally; gold at record high as tariff risks lurk
items.description: Asia shares rose on Friday, driven by the likely aversion of a U.S. government shutdown which boosted market sentiment. Gold hit a record high as trade tensions escalated, prompting investors to seek safe-haven assets. U.S. stock futures also surged in response to the positive news from Congress.

items.title: Up to 75% drop! Should you dump these 30 stocks that destroyed most wealth since last Holi?
items.description: While 56 stocks became multibaggers since last Holi, 30 stocks saw massive declines of nearly 50% or more due to market corrections. Smallcap stocks, including JaiPrakash Associates and Gensol Engineering, were hardest hit. Analysts suggest caution as volatility persists.

items.title: Market corrections and Warren Buffett’s timeless wisdom: Why investors should rejoice
items.description: Seasoned investors, like Anshul Saigal, view recent market corrections as valuable opportunities. Saigal, drawing from Warren Buffett’s philosophy, emphasises buying quality assets at reasonable valuations during downturns. With small and midcaps trading at favourable valuations, investors are advised to adopt a long-term perspective.

items.title: InterGlobe Aviation among 2025’s best stocks? Hemang Jani thinks so
items.description: Market expert Hemang Jani is bullish on IndiGo, citing infrastructure growth, stable crude prices, and operational efficiency as key drivers. With a 60% market share and upcoming airport developments, the airline is well-positioned for strong performance in 2025.

items.title: Exit on the rebound! Marc Faber’s urgent advice for investors
items.description: Marc Faber, known as "Dr. Doom," has urged retail investors to exit equities at the first sign of a rebound, warning of a prolonged global downturn. In a recent NDTV Profit interview, he stated that investors should exit positions in case the market rebounds.He emphasized that inflation might create an illusion of rising returns while actually eroding real value. He cautioned that the bear markets could persist for several years.

items.title: AC Demand set to surge in India: Amber Enterprise, Voltas could give 17-23% return in1 year
items.description: The Indian RAC industry is witnessing strong demand in FY25 despite compressor shortages. Manufacturers have managed supply issues through alternative sourcing and inventory management. With AC demand expected to grow at a 19% CAGR, industry players seek BIS certification extensions for key components.
